name: Italian
descriptions: The Italian program allows students to immerse themselves in Italian culture through courses in advanced grammar and composition, conversation, culture, cinema, and literature. All upper-level courses are taught in Italian, providing deep linguistic and cultural competency.

Italy is one of the most visited countries in the world, and Italian language skills enhance competitiveness in fields from art and design to international business. Students explore Italian theatrical, cinematic, and literary traditions spanning centuries of cultural history.

courses: MOLA 20003 - Cosmopolitanism: Thinking from a Global Perspective - 3 hrs. (gateway)

electiveCourses.description: Three courses taught in Italian at the 30000+ level (at least one at 40000+), plus two courses with ARAB, CHIN, FREN, GRMN, ITAL, JAPN, or MOLA prefix (max one taught in English). May include one interdisciplinary course with advisor approval.

features: Italian Club with conversation gatherings and cultural outings
Trips to Dallas Opera and local gelaterias
Study abroad through TCU Global semester and year-long programs
